I ordered salmon tartare, onion soup, and beef stew all less than ok.  Soup and stew were served barely warm.  Also portion size on stew incredibly small (turns out that was not a big problem as it was not interesting or delicious enough to eat) 
Salmon was over dressed with herbs.  Thought a restaurant at this location would be better because possibly they catered to the local Pac. Heights/Predsidio neighborhoods, not so it turns out.  Cute space but the food is not worth your time or money.

excerpts: We were given the option of outside seating which we didn't mind since they had heating.
Service was friendly and food decent.
Steak & frites ($30) was a too salty for me.
I'm not sure if it was the steak or the maitre d'butter and usual salad
is overly dressed.
Scallops were sweet and perfect  but light ($30)
I'd still be hungry if that was all I ordered.
Escargot ($12)was nothing to write home about.
.author: Naty D.
.review:
Came for Easter dinner without reservations. We were given the option of outside seating which we didn't mind since they had heating.  Service was friendly and food decent.  The last time we had French was terrible so this was nice change. 

Steak & frites ($30) was a too salty for me.  I'm not sure if it was the steak or the maitre d'butter and usual salad is overly dressed.  I keep forgetting to get dressing on the side. 

Scallops were sweet and perfect  but light ($30) I'd still be hungry if that was all I ordered.  Escargot ($12)was nothing to write home about. Loads of butter and also a little too salty.  

Neighborhood prix fixe seems like a deal and brunch menu looks good. Will have to give them another try. Feels like a loved neighborhood place.

excerpts: Great option for a first date (even though it wasn't ours)
.author: Wendy K.
.review:
Had a great time having dinner here on a Friday. There weren't too many people which is great for Friday night! The atmosphere is very cozy and cute, very French; tables are super close to each other that you have to pull your own table out to get in/out. As a result, you see some tables starting to have conversation with their neighbors, which is very pleasant :) 

For the two of us, we shared:
- half a dozen oysters: very fresh
- tomato soup: simple and tasty
- Risotto de Légumes: veggie risotto that is very homey 
- Moules Provençale: mussels with fries, a bit too buttery on the sauce, but tasty!

Overall, the food is good quality, delicious, and satisfying. Service is very friendly. I would recommend this to anyone that's looking for something low-key, pleasant but delicious meal.

The Presidio was only 2 blocks away, so it was also a great perk to take a walk after dinner! Great option for a first date (even though it wasn't ours)  ;)

excerpts: The staff is SOOOO personable.
I can't wait to keep going back and try everything on the menu!
.author: Evelyn W.
.review: Excellent food; excellent service... pet friendly!   The staff is SOOOO personable.  I can't wait to keep going back and try everything on the menu!

excerpts: Absolutely love this place...especially for the escargots!
They have really good soups like rich tomato and split pea.
The seafood pasta was a huge hit at our table.
Great service, too.
.author: Vickey K.
.review: Absolutely love this place...especially for the escargots!  They have really good soups like rich tomato and split pea.  The seafood pasta was a huge hit at our table.  Great service, too.

excerpts: Want to share our poor experience due to the very rude server at this bistro, which we previously found to be a quaint and lovely  little neighborhood spot.
We booked an open table rezzie for a somewhat spontaneous group dinner for a 40th bday for 8 people at 8 pm on Saturday evening.
While open table confirmed the reservation for 8 pm, the restaurant called and left a message for an 8:30 start instead.
Even if she truly believed our friend was too drunk to continue to be served, she could have very easily said it in a more professional way.
This was how the meal started.
Several of us have been to this establishment over the years and have been served by the French woman.
While she can be abrupt and very French, this time she crossed the line and was just plain horrible, putting a huge damper on an otherwise fun day and milestone for our friend.
.author: tammy o.
.review:
One star for shockingly poor service. Food is fine in fact quite nice as evidenced by the four stars of many of the guests but definitely not worth enduring this one particular French server. Want to share our poor experience due to the very rude server at this bistro, which we previously found to be a quaint and lovely  little neighborhood spot. We booked an open table rezzie for a somewhat spontaneous group dinner for a 40th bday for 8 people at 8 pm on Saturday evening. While open table confirmed the reservation for 8 pm, the restaurant called and left a message for an 8:30 start instead. No problem. 

However, When the group arrived, the server advised that the kitchen closed in an hour and everyone needed to hurry and get their order in. So, while they pushed out our start time by 30 mins we needed to hurry up and order. As a former server of a fast paced higher end seafood grill, I understand how the kitchen works and that it's nice to close up shop in a timely manner. But asking a group to come in later and then rushing them to order - was the first offputting event of the evening. Also, an 8 pm dinner on a Saturday night is hardly a late night dinner.  

Next, as she took the drink order, she singled out one of our group, the wife of the 40 year old and advised that she would give everyone drinks except her. The server said it loudly and in an Unkind way which was mortifying for our guest basically implying that she was too drunk to be served. My friend had a drink or two before dinner but was in no way, shape or form, sloppy or out of hand. We actually applaud when a server makes an assessment to decline drinks to someone who has been previously overserved but there were two problems with this: 1)she focused on the wrong person in the group (admittedly there were others who had been overserved) and 2)she said it in a way that was humiliating and loud. Even if she truly believed our friend was too drunk to continue to be served, she could have very easily said it in a more professional way.  This was how the meal started. Not good. 

The group had to make a fast decision to either stay and eat or to leave based on the very poor service and attitude but given the time of not and the size of the group, we decided to stick it out. Bad idea!

The server and one other staff member proceeded to sit and linger across from the table, while we finished our meal further adding to a very uncomfortable experience for what should have been a super fun night. 

If the restaurant didn't want a group of 8,at 8 pm on a Saturday night,they should not have accepted the reservation. 

I am born and raised in San Francisco as were several others at the table. Several of us have been to this establishment over the years and have been served by the French woman.  While she can be abrupt and very French, this time she crossed the line and was just plain horrible, putting a huge damper on an otherwise fun day and milestone for our friend. It was truly one of the worst experiences with a server any of us have ever had. 

Needless to say, no one will be returning and we will do our best to let our friends, family and acquaintances that the service is seriously subpar.

excerpts: Dined here three times over the course of a month and each time it met and exceeded my expectations.
Eggs Benedict and mimosa were perfect, outdoor seating for brunch was great,  small, friendly, local walking families stopping in.
Dinner of Mussels and french fries were fantastic and over the top in flavor, preparation and size of portions!
Waitress was super and efficient and friendly.
Definitely go here.
.author: Diane A.
.review: Dined here three times over the course of a month and each time it met and exceeded my expectations.  Eggs Benedict and mimosa were perfect, outdoor seating for brunch was great,  small, friendly, local walking families stopping in.  Dinner of Mussels and french fries were fantastic and over the top in flavor, preparation and size of portions! Waitress was super and efficient and friendly.  Definitely go here.

excerpts: We loved everything in this place.
All of the cheeses in every dish was exceptional.
A wonderful little find with friendly service and a cozy atmosphere.
.author: Michelle D.
.review: We loved everything in this place.  All of the cheeses in every dish was exceptional.  A wonderful little find with friendly service and a cozy atmosphere.

excerpts: This place is beyond fabulous!
Reservations for 7:30 and we were seated on time even though the place was crazy busy.
We had the escargot which were little pieces of heaven in a garlic/butter sauce that I wanted to lick off the plate.
Our friends had a lovely goat cheese salad.
Main: I had the duck a la orange.
It was perfection!!!
If you love duck, get yourself there and order this!!!
Served with spinach and a crispy polenta.
Here's the thing - I do not like polenta.
Not one bit - yuck.
I LOVED this!
Hubby had the lamb chops were were also perfect.
My cousin had the lamb stew which was heavenly.
For dessert you have to try the strawberries in a balsamic- brown sugar glaze thing over ice cream.
To die for!!!
For 4 of us, with corkage (one of our party bought their wine), 2 desserts  the bill was 208.
.author: Debi S.
.review:
OMG!!!! This place is beyond fabulous!  This is undoubtedly the best French food is SF, reasonably priced, excellent service and great location!!!  

Reservations for 7:30 and we were seated on time even though the place was crazy busy.  We had the escargot which were little pieces of heaven in a garlic/butter sauce that I wanted to lick off the plate. Our friends had a lovely goat cheese salad.  Main: I had the duck a la orange. It was perfection!!!  If you love duck, get yourself there and order this!!!  Served with spinach and a crispy polenta.  Here's the thing - I do not like polenta.  Not one bit - yuck.  I LOVED this!  Hubby had the lamb chops were were also perfect.  My cousin had the lamb stew which was heavenly.  For dessert you have to try the strawberries in a balsamic- brown sugar glaze thing over ice cream.  To die for!!!  For 4 of us, with corkage (one of our party bought their wine), 2 desserts  the bill was 208.  With tip, about 125 a couple and worth every penny!!

What a great evening and I can't wait to go back!!!

excerpts: I know I hate being TOO full, but I  was hungry by the time I got on the Caltrain and back home like 1.5 hours later.
.author: Aria S.
.review:
Came here for a shockingly warm Valentine's Day brunch with a platonic friend lol. 

There was no wait and we sat outside which was nice. All the other tables were full, so I assume there's normally some kind of wait. 

The place is a little disjointed and I think perhaps understaffed. We had two different people serving us, and it confused us a little, and had to ask a few times to get things. No biggie, just something that I noticed. I feel like brunch spots are usually superr busy, so keeping everything tight is important. 

I ordered the ratattui (however you spell it...) eggs not to be confused with the cute movie about the rat. I thought it was unique and French and might as well try it. For a french restaurant, this place had a decent amount of veg options. I was thoroughly unimpressed with my meal, and the ratttoui...brb I'm just going to google this. Ok ratatouille. My ratatouille (obviously just copy/pasted) wasn't very flavorful. Coulda used some basic s/p and maybe fresh herbs. The bread wasn't fresh either and I thought maybe a French brunch place would pride themselves in that. Also you know how you usually leave Sunday bruch stufffeddd and ready to Netflix and chill the rest of the day? I know I hate being TOO full, but I  was hungry by the time I got on the Caltrain and back home like 1.5 hours later. 

Nice, cute spot, walking distance to Palace of Fine Arts + GG Bridge, but otherwise my food was just alrighty.

excerpts: We were walking out of the Presidio looking for a place to eat for lunch when I saw that I had bookmarked this place on Yelp.
There were 2 sets of doors and there was no sign
so it wasn't clear which one to go in from.
When we walked in, we asked for a table of 4 and the only server there said she would get a table for us shortly and asked us to wait outside.
What was supposed to be a short wait ended up being over 15 minutes.
By that time, I was starving so
Once we got seated, we realized they were serving brunch.
I'm not a huge fan of brunch so my choices of food was limited.
We were ready to order, but since there was only one server, it took forever for her to make it to our table.
Although we flagged her down, she still didn't come by right away.
By that time, I was getting annoyed.
We had to wait 15 minutes to order.
For a small place like that, it seemed like it was too much for her to handle.
I ordered a Croque Madame, which was a hot ham and cheese sandwich with fried egg on top along with a side of fries.
When my food came out, it didn't look too appealing as it was a big flat sandwich smothered with cheese and a side of mixed green salad.
My father-in-law said it looked like a patty melt.
Although it was nothing special, I ended up eating most of it since I was hungry and giving the rest to my husband.
When we were done, we were ready to leave, but had to wait 15 minutes to get our check.
They said they had to reboot the computer, but by then, I was done with their excuses and being so slow.
I don't think I'll ever come back again.
.author: Erica S.
.review:
We were walking out of the Presidio looking for a place to eat for lunch when I saw that I had bookmarked this place on Yelp.  There were 2 sets of doors and there was no sign so it wasn't clear which one to go in from.  When we walked in, we asked for a table of 4 and the only server there said she would get a table for us shortly and asked us to wait outside.  What was supposed to be a short wait ended up being over 15 minutes.  By that time, I was starving so I prayed that this place was going to be worth the wait.

Once we got seated, we realized they were serving brunch.  I'm not a huge fan of brunch so my choices of food was limited.  We were ready to order, but since there was only one server, it took forever for her to make it to our table.  Although we flagged her down, she still didn't come by right away.  By that time, I was getting annoyed.  We had to wait 15 minutes to order.  For a small place like that, it seemed like it was too much for her to handle.  The more annoying part was that she was more attentive to the table next to us and often ignored us.

I ordered a Croque Madame, which was a hot ham and cheese sandwich with fried egg on top along with a side of fries.  When my food came out, it didn't look too appealing as it was a big flat sandwich smothered with cheese and a side of mixed green salad.  My father-in-law said it looked like a patty melt.  Although it was nothing special, I ended up eating most of it since I was hungry and giving the rest to my husband.  The fries were good, but nothing special either.  

When we were done, we were ready to leave, but had to wait 15 minutes to get our check.  They said they had to reboot the computer, but by then, I was done with their excuses and being so slow.  I don't think I'll ever come back again.

excerpts: 5 stars for the mussels alone.
Really the best mussels I have ever had and
I will certainly plan to return for those.

The service was great, seating a bit cramped with other parties, but one of the couples next to us had brought a good bottle of wine with them and they weren't finishing it so shared with us which was really nice, and I would say the environment of this place breeds that type of hospitality.
Great spot
and I can't wait to get back.
.author: Joshua D.
.review: 5 stars for the mussels alone.  Really the best mussels I have ever had and I will certainly plan to return for those.  The service was great, seating a bit cramped with other parties, but one of the couples next to us had brought a good bottle of wine with them and they weren't finishing it so shared with us which was really nice, and I would say the environment of this place breeds that type of hospitality.  Great spot and I can't wait to get back.

excerpts: I think that our infatuation with this place is over.
Still solid food, but
Fresh Squeezed Limonade $3.5:
One of the better lemonades (or lime-aid?)
I've had.
Very intense flavor and plenty of kick.
Not too sweet and super tangy.
Perfect.
Sandwich de Baguette $10:
Kinda small really.
Decent length, but it's less than 2in wide.
Standard grocery store ham.
Cheese was artisan though.
Greens salad was okay.
Oeufs Baker Street Bistro $14.5:
I wouldn't make this my restaurant's signature dish for sure.
The eggs benedict is pretty standard.
The poached eggs themselves were good with correctly running yolks.
But really not a fan of the tomato sauce.
I applaud them for trying to be unique, but I would work on this one more.
I suppose there's potential, but to me this is not much better than pouring canned spaghetti sauce on your eggs.
Also, the seasoned potatoes it comes with are soggy and wet--left most of it.
.author: Dean C.
.review:
8/1/15:  I think that our infatuation with this place is over.  Still solid food, but I don't think it's anything special anymore.

1. Fresh Squeezed Limonade $3.5:  One of the better lemonades (or lime-aid?) I've had.  Very intense flavor and plenty of kick.  Not too sweet and super tangy.  Perfect.  9/10

2. Sandwich de Baguette $10:  Kinda small really.  Decent length, but it's less than 2in wide.  Standard grocery store ham.  Cheese was artisan though.  Greens salad was okay.  5/10

3. Oeufs Baker Street Bistro $14.5:  I wouldn't make this my restaurant's signature dish for sure.  The eggs benedict is pretty standard.  The poached eggs themselves were good with correctly running yolks.  But really not a fan of the tomato sauce.  I applaud them for trying to be unique, but I would work on this one more.  I suppose there's potential, but to me this is not much better than pouring canned spaghetti sauce on your eggs.  Also, the seasoned potatoes it comes with are soggy and wet--left most of it.  4/10

Good brunch, but not worth a special trip or anything.

3/5

#french #breakfast #brunch #lemonade #eggsbenedict

Friendly service

Cons :  long wait for food
.author: Bayarea K.
.review:
Pros:  no wait 
            Friendly service

Cons :  long wait for food
              Food is ok
             Street parking

excerpts: After looking at the menu and making our choice, Oeufs Copenhague which is poached eggs and Salmon  and Pain Perdu which is cinnamon French toast, we attempt to order and the server says we're all out of Pain Perdu.
Well that's a disappointment
so we decide to split the Oeufs Copenhague with some coffee.
Time goes by and nothing is brought to us, no coffee no water, nothing.
The couple next to us was seated at the same time and already had their coffee and water.
We had to flag someone down and ask for our coffee.
We finally get our poached eggs and Salmon and the taste is good but nothing out of the ordinary.
We drink our average coffee
but we're never offered refills.
.author: Joseph F.
.review:
Baker Street Bistro was a disappointment. My husband and I like to try out different brunch places around the city and we were in the Marina area so we thought we would check it out. 

The wait wasn't too long on an early Sunday afternoon so that should have been a hint that it wasn't going to be too great. After looking at the menu and making our choice, Oeufs Copenhague which is poached eggs and Salmon  and Pain Perdu which is cinnamon French toast, we attempt to order and the server says we're all out of Pain Perdu. Well that's a disappointment so we decide to split the Oeufs Copenhague with some coffee. Time goes by and nothing is brought to us, no coffee no water, nothing. The couple next to us was seated at the same time and already had their coffee and water. We had to flag someone down and ask for our coffee. We finally get our poached eggs and Salmon and the taste is good but nothing out of the ordinary. We drink our average coffee but we're never offered refills. There are still no servers around so we have to go to the front for the check. 

With so many options in San Francisco we won't be coming back to this restaurant.

excerpts: When you are greeted at the door on a Saturday night by a sloppy (though, perfectly pleasant) kid in flip flops at a restaurant that is charging $30 for mains, you get a little suspicious.
Woefully understaffed.
There was one woman kicking ass and covering all the tables.
French onion soup had good flavor but was topped with a cheap cheese.
Green salad, was a pile of lettuce on a plate with a handful of under ripened beefsteak tomato pieces, I guess you would call them.
I mean, lettuce is lettuce, not bad but not noteworthy.
The cassoulet was like someone had seen an ingredients list and a picture - but not looked too closely at it - and decided to give it a whirl.
Cheap ingredients cooked separately poured into a clay dish at the end, which is just wrong.
The risotto was soupy rice with a thick layer of cheese on it.
I'm not even sure what it was
but it wasn't risotto.
The server noticed how we left both mains basically untouched and took them off our bill, which was appreciated.
If there are people from France cooking in that kitchen they should of gone home that night in a puddle of shame.
.author: Elizabeth H.
.review:
When you are greeted at the door on a Saturday night by a sloppy (though, perfectly pleasant) kid in flip flops at a restaurant that is charging $30 for mains, you get a little suspicious.  If I'm going to lay down over $100 on a meal, I want a little more, like shoes.

Woefully understaffed.  There was one woman kicking ass and covering all the tables.  Kudos to her for keeping it together.

Food was just bad.
French onion soup had good flavor but was topped with a cheap cheese.  Green salad, was a pile of lettuce on a plate with a handful of under ripened beefsteak tomato pieces, I guess you would call them.  I mean, lettuce is lettuce, not bad but not noteworthy.
The cassoulet was like someone had seen an ingredients list and a picture - but not looked too closely at it - and decided to give it a whirl.  Cheap ingredients cooked separately poured into a clay dish at the end, which is just wrong.  
The risotto was soupy rice with a thick layer of cheese on it.  I'm not even sure what it was but it wasn't risotto.  All the ingredients tasted cheap actually, that was the most upsetting part.

The server noticed how we left both mains basically untouched and took them off our bill, which was appreciated.  As I stated earlier, she was kicking ass.

If there are people from France cooking in that kitchen they should of gone home that night in a puddle of shame.  Same with the manager who was having flip flop guy do the hosting. 

I do know we will not be back.

excerpts: The food, ambiance, and service are all awesome.
The charcuterie plate was delicious with nice selection of meats.
Good selection of wines.
Great outdoor seating for the day and cozy indoor space for dinner.
The lady serving is very friendly and answers any questions about the menu gladly and in detail!
.author: Neha M.
.review: The food, ambiance, and service are all awesome.  The charcuterie plate was delicious with nice selection of meats. Good selection of wines. Great outdoor seating for the day and cozy indoor space for dinner. The lady serving is very friendly and answers any questions about the menu gladly and in detail!

excerpts: For Entrees (appetizers) we had Escargot Bourguignon, Soupe à l'Oignon, Salade Verte Vinaigrette, and Foie Gras.
The escargot tasted only of butter - not even a hint of garlic.
The onion soup looked good, but had very little taste - the broth was almost like water.
The salad was fine, but it is hard to mess up mixed greens from a box with a vinaigrette.
For Plats we had Bourride Provençale; Steak Grillé, Beurre Maître d'Hôtel, Pomme Frites; and Boeuf Bourguignon.
The guest having the fish stew could only describe it as "interesting."
He was unwilling to provide any further details.
The Boeuf Bourguignon was mediocre at best.
I'm used to Boeuf Bourguignon having a gravy that is red from the wine- not brown.
Plus it is generally served with peas, onions, and potatoes, not potatoes and carrots which is more American.
In addition, it had not been prepared recently.
Dessert included Tarte Tartin à la Poire,  Fraises Balsamic, and Profiteroles.

The dough for the  
Profiteroles was so tough that it required a knife to cut them - enough said.
The Fraises Balsamic was made with strawberries that were so far from ripe that they had no taste whatsoever.
The Tarte Tartin was described as "tasteless and boring.

"

Service went from one extreme to the other.
The joint opinion on the meal was "meh."
We won't be back.
.author: Scott M.
.review:
If tasteless food is what you crave, you'll find it here.

There were three of us for dinner.

For Entrees (appetizers) we had Escargot Bourguignon, Soupe à l'Oignon, Salade Verte Vinaigrette, and Foie Gras.  The escargot tasted only of butter - not even a hint of garlic.  The onion soup looked good, but had very little taste - the broth was almost like water.  The salad was fine, but it is hard to mess up mixed greens from a box with a vinaigrette.  The foie gras was well prepared, but the most remarkable thing about the dish was the fruit spread and the grilled grapes.

For Plats we had Bourride Provençale; Steak Grillé, Beurre Maître d'Hôtel, Pomme Frites; and Boeuf Bourguignon.  The guest having the fish stew could only describe it as "interesting."  He was unwilling to provide any further details.  The Boeuf Bourguignon was mediocre at best.  I'm used to Boeuf Bourguignon having a gravy that is red from the wine- not brown.  Plus it is generally served with peas, onions, and potatoes, not potatoes and carrots which is more American.  In addition, it had not been prepared recently.  The steak seemed to be the best of the choices made - a sad reflection on a French restaurant.

Dessert included Tarte Tartin à la Poire,  Fraises Balsamic, and Profiteroles.  The dough for the  
Profiteroles was so tough that it required a knife to cut them - enough said.  The Fraises Balsamic was made with strawberries that were so far from ripe that they had no taste whatsoever.  The Tarte Tartin was described as "tasteless and boring."

Service went from one extreme to the other.  Either they were always at the table or they totally ignored you.

The joint opinion on the meal was "meh."  We won't be back.

excerpts: Food is excellent, recommended.
Mussels are really good.
Only drawback is difficult to find parking.
.author: K W.
.review: Food is excellent, recommended.  Mussels are really good.  Only drawback is difficult to find parking.

excerpts: French without the snottiness.
I'd call it "upscale peasant French".
Could there be a more perfect possible choice on a cold winter evening?
My cassoulet was impeccable: a crispy duck leg with meat falling off the bone; garlic sausage, tomatoes, bacon and onions in a perfectly-seasoned white bean stew.
It tasted like the ingredients had been cooking together for a week.
(Had they?)
My friends loved their Beef Bourguignon, and my daughter J put a serious dent in their steak and fries.
.author: Dan B.
.review:
French without the snottiness.  I'd call it "upscale peasant French". Could there be a more perfect possible choice on a cold winter evening? I'll leave that as an exercise for the reader.

We were here for dinner before a show at the Palace of Fine Arts; a great pick from my friends J and M. Service was attentive but casual, and we were allowed to wallow in the menu as long as we liked. (We had a bit of extra time).  

One sign of a good restaurant: So many things I wanted to try on the menu! Yet I could only pick one (damn). But it was winter and they had cassoulet on the specials list. So in the end the choice was inevitable (for me).

My cassoulet was impeccable: a crispy duck leg with meat falling off the bone; garlic sausage, tomatoes, bacon and onions in a perfectly-seasoned white bean stew.  It tasted like the ingredients had been cooking together for a week. (Had they?)  I almost hurt myself finishing it.

My friends loved their Beef Bourguignon, and my daughter J put a serious dent in their steak and fries.  Very happy tummies all around.

The wine list wasn't spectacular but it didn't need to be. Upscale peasant french doesn't require $200 bottles, and they had plenty to choose from, and from all styles. I enjoyed a glass of syrah while my friends were tasting pinots.

Dessert was a blissful blur; they had my favorite ending for a big meal: a small chocolate mousse, a glass of port, and a coffee.

After dinner we flowed happily out into the cold night. It was a good thing we walked to the show, just to shed some some of those excess calories; I'd say they were the highest-quality calories I've had in a long while!

excerpts: We went to Baker Street Bistro to celebrate the wife's birthday.
Best decision for the day.
The food.
Wvery dish from aperitif to entrée to dessert was excellent.
I ordered the charcuterie and it was fantastic.
A nice selection of cured meats and paté large enough to share.
The soup de jour was mushroom and it was very smooth in texture and not overly creamy.
The escargot was perfectly tender.
Flor entrée
I ordered the seafood stew.
It had plenty of variety and was savory and tasty.
The duck breast was perfectly cook and not dried nor greasy.
For dessert we had the tartin,  mousse chocolat and fraises balsmic.
All were good but the fraises balsamic was fantastic.
As soon as we ordered it our server immediately said we would love it.
The setting was as well.
.author: P.Y. H.
.review:
We went to Baker Street Bistro to celebrate the wife's birthday.  Best decision for the day.  It is now our new favorite french place to go in the city. 

The food.  Wvery dish from aperitif to entrée to dessert was excellent. I ordered the charcuterie and it was fantastic.  A nice selection of cured meats and paté large enough to share.  The soup de jour was mushroom and it was very smooth in texture and not overly creamy.  The escargot was perfectly tender.  Flor entrée I ordered the seafood stew.  It had plenty of variety and was savory and tasty.  The duck breast was perfectly cook and not dried nor greasy.  The lamb chops were very tender and flavorful.

For dessert we had the tartin,  mousse chocolat and fraises balsmic.  All were good but the fraises balsamic was fantastic.  As soon as we ordered it our server immediately said we would love it. She was right, we did. 

The service was excellent and the timing of each service was just right. The setting was as well.  Small and quaint in a neighborhood setting. 

Cannot wait to return again.

excerpts: Looking for a brunch spot after a hike in the presidio and ended up here at this cute little bistro.
Tried the French toast and the Canadian ham benedict.
Both were good and hit the spot since I was kind of starving.
.author: Vanessa C.
.review:
Looking for a brunch spot after a hike in the presidio and ended up here at this cute little bistro.  Service is friendly, though was hard to grab their attention when we were ready to get the bill.

Tried the French toast and the Canadian ham benedict.  Both were good and hit the spot since I was kind of starving.  I could've done without the coulis with the French toast but it definitely added to the visual presentation.

Sitting outside with a cup of latte and good company made for the perfect end to our hike.

excerpts: I won't lie - when my friends told me we were going to the Marina for brunch, I cringed a little bit.
It's already a tough area for parking, but factor in the gorgeous weather drawing people outside
and it was going to be that much worse.
At least, so I thought - multiple spaces in front?
On top of getting nearby parking and the sunny skies above, it was awesome that we were able to snag a table outside.
What's more...the food was pretty good!

Although nothing about it really stood out, my Eggs Benedict dish wasn't too shabby (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/baker-street-bistro-san-francisco?select=TYWWiz3J2mPo91QQWMd9uw#AyUN2fM9ww-44ggpPSEAaw).
The eggs were poached perfectly, the Hollandaise sauce had just a touch of acidity, and the Canadian baon was oh so good.
Sadly, the home fries were my least favorite part of the dish.
my friend had ordered for the three of us to share.

Although the added fruit and strawberry coulis made the dish a little sweeter than I would have liked, the French troast was terrific (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/baker-street-bistro-san-francisco?select=TYWWiz3J2mPo91QQWMd9uw#rgpaXJRizzFg-jKuv3Z31g).
The slices were lightly browned, covered with just the right amount of cinnamon, and maintained some bite while still soaking in the syrup.
Based on our meal and the reviews I read from other Yelpers, I'd say there's a fairly decent chance I'll be back at some point to check out their dinner menu.
However, as much as I would like to say it would be soley because of the food, the (relative) wealth of parking in this part of the Marina might have something to do with it too.
Hey, can't fault me for being honest!
.author: Mike L.
.review:
I won't lie - when my friends told me we were going to the Marina for brunch, I cringed a little bit.  It's already a tough area for parking, but factor in the gorgeous weather drawing people outside and it was going to be that much worse.  At least, so I thought - multiple spaces in front?  I like this Baker Street Bistro place already!

On top of getting nearby parking and the sunny skies above, it was awesome that we were able to snag a table outside.  What's more...the food was pretty good!  Although nothing about it really stood out, my Eggs Benedict dish wasn't too shabby (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/baker-street-bistro-san-francisco?select=TYWWiz3J2mPo91QQWMd9uw#AyUN2fM9ww-44ggpPSEAaw).  The eggs were poached perfectly, the Hollandaise sauce had just a touch of acidity, and the Canadian baon was oh so good.  Sadly, the home fries were my least favorite part of the dish.  Although they weren't awful, they weren't as good as they could have been either (needed more seasoning).

What did stand out for me was the Pain Perdu (Cinnamon French Toast) my friend had ordered for the three of us to share.  Although the added fruit and strawberry coulis made the dish a little sweeter than I would have liked, the French troast was terrific (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/baker-street-bistro-san-francisco?select=TYWWiz3J2mPo91QQWMd9uw#rgpaXJRizzFg-jKuv3Z31g).  The slices were lightly browned, covered with just the right amount of cinnamon, and maintained some bite while still soaking in the syrup.  No soggy and mushy French toast here!

Based on our meal and the reviews I read from other Yelpers, I'd say there's a fairly decent chance I'll be back at some point to check out their dinner menu.  However, as much as I would like to say it would be soley because of the food, the (relative) wealth of parking in this part of the Marina might have something to do with it too.  Hey, can't fault me for being honest!

excerpts: This cafe has both indoor and outdoor seating available and the ability to accommodate large groups.
The waitress is charming and makes great menu recommendations.
The seafood stew is a must try.
Not only was the broth absolutely delicious but the stew was LOADED with seafood and absolutely did not skimp!
My relatives, who were visiting me from Taiwan, beamed about how delicious it was.
In fact, everything I've tried, from the omelette to the duck confit, has been very good.
I use this spot to entertain business colleagues whenever they are in town and it has never disappointed.

Highly recommend!
.
.author: Linda H.
.review:
This cafe has both indoor and outdoor seating available and the ability to accommodate large groups.  The waitress is charming and makes great menu recommendations.  Nearby street parking was very easy to find and the restaurant is a short stroll to the Palace of Fine Arts.  

The seafood stew is a must try.  Not only was the broth absolutely delicious but the stew was LOADED with seafood and absolutely did not skimp!  My relatives, who were visiting me from Taiwan, beamed about how delicious it was.  In fact, everything I've tried, from the omelette to the duck confit, has been very good.  Prices are very reasonable, especially for the quality of the food provided.

I use this spot to entertain business colleagues whenever they are in town and it has never disappointed.  Highly recommend!
.

excerpts: As soon as my friends and I  walked in  we  felt  welcome
I would totally recommend this place.
.author: Michelle C.
.review:
Had a great brunch meal! 
As soon as my friends and I  walked in  we  felt  welcome 
I would totally recommend this place.

excerpts: Even with no make-up, she can make head turns faster than
Wile E. Coyote.
Then, you have the other sibling who is to nicely put it "unfortunate looking".
With her make-up skills, she ends up looking like Mimi Bobeck from The Drew Carey show.
I totally feel for her as I've probably been mistaken for a tranny with my quad layer caked on make-up, tattooed eyebrows, and triple stacked whore lashes mid-day.
.author: Cherylynn N.
.review:
2.5 STARS

We've ALL seen it (though may not admit it)...

One sibling is the epitome of hotness exuding both sex appeal and beauty from head-to-toe. Even with no make-up, she can make head turns faster than  Wile E. Coyote. Then, you have the other sibling who is to nicely put it "unfortunate looking". With her make-up skills, she ends up looking like Mimi Bobeck from The Drew Carey show. I totally feel for her as I've probably been mistaken for a tranny with my quad layer caked on make-up, tattooed eyebrows, and triple stacked whore lashes mid-day. Sadly, not everyone can be as fortunate. 

Baker Street Bistro IS that "unfortunate" sibling. One of my most memorable meals last year was at its sister restaurant, Bistro Central Parc (my review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/bistro-central-parc-san-francisco#hrid:8iXzFqkMP-OUolQ737sZkg). There, the food was just as amazing as the service which was a complete opposite from my experience at Baker Street Bistro.

F O O D
Needing to feed my foie gras addiction before the upcoming ban in 10 days, I dragged Mr. NSS here because they had three featured foie gras dishes which is the only reason I choose Baker Street Bistro for dinner. 

*Escargot Bourguignon in Garlic & Parsley Sauce ($10.50) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xc9iz3CT9v133LFdjhOZcQ?select=9APlC6s9R3UCiV3iYZCP-A#V8MQpBbNqjwetBABV2va_A
The best part of our meal, the escargot was tenderly soft with a tantalizing garlicky herbaceousness.
 
*Pan Seared Foie Gras & Smoked Duck Breast w/ Pine Nuts & Duck Gizzard Confit Salad ($16.50) - 3.5 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xc9iz3CT9v133LFdjhOZcQ?select=9APlC6s9R3UCiV3iYZCP-A#TYWWiz3J2mPo91QQWMd9uw
Surprisingly, the smoked duck breast was the winner in the dish. It was rich and tender with just the right amount of smoky flavor to awaken my taste buds. The foie gras tasted like almost like regular liver and lacked the quintessential rich decadence.    

*Tournedos Rossini: Pan Seared Beef Tenderloin Topped w/ Pan Seared Foie Gras ($29) - 2 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xc9iz3CT9v133LFdjhOZcQ?select=9APlC6s9R3UCiV3iYZCP-A#ZLuekYfJ7-0-WebCba8RiA
The Tournedos Rossini was a disappointment both in quality and execution. The bland beef tenderloin was difficult to cut and had tons of fibrous connective tissue having not been broken down making the steak extra chewy (at least my mouth got a work out). The lack of richness from the foie gras and the watery demi-glace made this dish utterly disappointing. 

Poor Mr. NSS's dish looked like a reduced fat dinner plate which he didn't like. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xc9iz3CT9v133LFdjhOZcQ?select=9APlC6s9R3UCiV3iYZCP-A#gLaYkZwsOkUb87v5wmydeQ

S E R V I C E
Contrived friendliness with a complete lack of attentiveness is not what I expected from a seemingly charming neighborhood restaurant especially after having received such warm, genuine, and attentive service from its sister restaurant, Bistro Central Parc. Mr. NSS had to go inside to ask for the bill and go back inside to pay for it. A bit inexcusable. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Parisian bistro meets French country nook with crisp white linen tables, outdoor patio seating, yellow hued walls, and rustic wooden furnishings. Seating is tight and meant for small parties no more than four. 

P A R K I N G
Moderate to difficult street parking. 

With just less than 10 days before the foie gras ban, Baker Street Bistro is not a place I would recommend to indulge in your foie gras' desires. When you bite into foie gras, a burst of luxurious richness should coat every crevice of your mouth and have you grinning from ear-to-ear. It should make your toes curl and your eyes roll back into your head. The foie gras at Baker Street Bistro was like boring, mediocre, and mundane sex. *yawn* If you want mind-blowing "sex", please do yourself a favor and go to La Folie or Alexander's Steakhouse before the ban.

Unless you like boring, mediocre, and mundane "sex" than by all means. To each their own...

excerpts: The service was fast and friendly.
.author: Moe O.
.review:
Solid five stars here. The food was excellent. The service was fast and friendly.  The sun was out so the patio was perfect.

I had the eggs with ratatouille and salad with orange juice everything was tasty!

excerpts: We brought a bottle of wine and enjoyed it with the foie gras, muscles proquette with fries  and the pork chop.
All delicious but the muscles were some of the best I've tasted.
The sauce was so good!
The service was great.
.author: Nathan S.
.review: I was so fortunate to get a reservation here on New Year's Eve. We brought a bottle of wine and enjoyed it with the foie gras, muscles proquette with fries  and the pork chop. All delicious but the muscles were some of the best I've tasted. The sauce was so good! The service was great.

excerpts: Each escargot was literally the size of a pea (yes, a pea), and even with the garlic butter sauce their taste was pitiful.
My friend had the risotto and gave it a  5/10.
We both had ordered a glass of wine before the meal  and not once did the server come by to offer a refill - I sadly had to try and flag her down.
.author: Bobby J.
.review:
Oh heavens, what a bad experience. I have not been on Yelp for quite some time but this dining experience got me livid enough to go back on and write this review. Living in the city and looking for a good French food experience to try for dinner (and seeing the reviews), we thought perhaps we could not go wrong with trying 'Baker Street Bistro'.

Along with my dining partner, we were squeezed into a table for two that even Munchkins could not feel comfortable fitting in. After being given menus, it took forever for the server to return to the table to take our order. So, let's cut to the chase...

The French onion Soup was tasteless. Each escargot was literally the size of a pea (yes, a pea), and even with the garlic butter sauce their taste was pitiful.  My friend had the risotto and gave it a  5/10. We both had ordered a glass of wine before the meal  and not once did the server come by to offer a refill - I sadly had to try and flag her down.

I just wanted to get the check and leave.

Yelpers: Spend your hard earned money elsewhere.

excerpts: The owner should hire more  server.
.author: Roski L.
.review: definitely terrible service. server Looks unhappy and without patience. Ignore our request for times. Leave us at seats even we ask for service. Treat us randomly maybe because of automatically 20% tips. Dropped water on my bag with my phone,charging baby and purse on it while I went to restroom. Didn't try to dry my bag first. Very Interesting. The owner should hire more  server.

excerpts: Ordered the oeuf  ratatouille and it was just okay.
Some items on menu was pricey for a small bistro.
.author: Philip T.
.review: Came here for brunch. Service was painfully slow. Ordered the oeuf  ratatouille and it was just okay. Some items on menu was pricey for a small bistro.

excerpts: A little bit of Paris right in San Francisco!
Shared Oeufs Benedict and the cream based (rather than white wine based) mussels.
Giant bowl of delicious mussels with perfectly crispy fries.
Service was excellent!
.author: Kathleen W.
.review:
A little bit of Paris right in San Francisco!  Sat outside on a beautiful Sunday afternoon after a morning of walking for the JL House Tours.  

Shared Oeufs Benedict and the cream based (rather than white wine based) mussels.  Giant bowl of delicious mussels with perfectly crispy fries.  Service was excellent!

excerpts: Saw this place on "Check Please!" and had to "check" it out.
Got a nice window seat with pillows which was really spacious and comfy.
Ordered a bottle of the best rose they had.
He offered for me to taste it
and I said to just pour
and he made me feel like a turd for not tasting the wine.
It was a fifty dollar bottle
do we really have to go through with this?
Oh how the French can unknowingly make us feel like the uncultured animals that we are lol.
He was cool
but there you have it.
My mom is a French native and I have been to France and Paris more times than I can remember so
our "Parisian Style" server was exactly that to the T.
After the wine came he fired all of our app's and loaded up our table like it was a Chinese food restaurant.
It worked out well since two of our app's were molten straight from the broiler
The goat cheese salad had a great vinaigrette and diced tomato garnish.
It was good.
The goat cheese was bread crusted and deep fried in their frier.
The half dozen oysters were sweet and delicious.
Served on a bed of Ice with lemon and a mild mignonette.
My wife loved the escargot.
I thought it was good too.
I noticed that they use tarragon in the butter which I was ok with
but IMO is too sweet for escargot.
The onion soup was perfect.
Not too much crouton inside, cheese all over the bowl and toasted nicely.
Perfect gratin.
Excellent savoir.
Lots of broth.
Not too many onions.
Overflowing and spilling all over the soup charger when you crack into it.
Best balance of onion soup ingredients in a bowl in SF for sure.
Cream in mussels is already pushing it for me but the tarragon was a deal breaker for me at this point.
No mussel envy as I ate my entire steak frite salad.
I think even the compound butter on my steak had tarragon
but it was not killing the steak which I happily ate up with a side of french mustard.
I love steak frite salad.
I think it is one of my favorites.
The steak here was a bit on the smaller side no more than 8oz.
for sure.  Trimmed more than I like
but it was good.
Excellent Frites.
I ordered a Chimay and they brought and poured me a Duvel.
The creme brulee was good to excellent.
Vanilla beans on the bottom and all.
The Chocolate mousse was excellent.
I took one bite of it and the whole meal pretty much kicked in
and I was KO'ed for the night.
I slept so good after this meal.
Better than I had in a long time.
That says a lot.
I will be back for sure to try their brunch maybe.
I will be back for the $22 prix fix chefs choice menu for sure as well.
Good value
I would have to think for this level of food.
.author: Johnny B.
.review:
Three and a half stars, on the three side for my particular review. Close though.

Saw this place on "Check Please!" and had to "check" it out.  Got a nice window seat with pillows which was really spacious and comfy.  Ordered a bottle of the best rose they had.  He offered for me to taste it and I said to just pour and he made me feel like a turd for not tasting the wine.  It was a fifty dollar bottle do we really have to go through with this?  Oh how the French can unknowingly make us feel like the uncultured animals that we are lol.  He was cool but there you have it.  My mom is a French native and I have been to France and Paris more times than I can remember so our "Parisian Style" server was exactly that to the T.
After the wine came he fired all of our app's and loaded up our table like it was a Chinese food restaurant.  It worked out well since two of our app's were molten straight from the broiler but it was his call to bring out four dishes all at once.  

We had four app's and I had no problem finishing my steak frite salad.

The goat cheese salad had a great vinaigrette and diced tomato garnish.  It was good.  The goat cheese was bread crusted and deep fried in their frier. Portion was good to big.

The half dozen oysters were sweet and delicious.  Served on a bed of Ice with lemon and a mild mignonette.  Sweet small tasty fresh oysters shucked with no shell broken into the meat.

My wife loved the escargot.  I thought it was good too.  I noticed that they use tarragon in the butter which I was ok with but IMO is too sweet for escargot.  I still had no problem eating this buttery delicious dish.  

The onion soup was perfect.  Not too much crouton inside, cheese all over the bowl and toasted nicely.  Perfect gratin.  Excellent savoir.  Lots of broth.  Not too many onions.  Overflowing and spilling all over the soup charger when you crack into it.  Best balance of onion soup ingredients in a bowl in SF for sure.  Not like a chowder like often results even when I make the stuff.  

My wife had the mussels and the tarragon was completely blowing the dish away. Cream in mussels is already pushing it for me but the tarragon was a deal breaker for me at this point.  No mussel envy as I ate my entire steak frite salad.  I think even the compound butter on my steak had tarragon but it was not killing the steak which I happily ate up with a side of french mustard.  I love steak frite salad.  I think it is one of my favorites.  The steak here was a bit on the smaller side no more than 8oz. for sure.  Trimmed more than I like but it was good.  Excellent Frites.  Good salad.

My wife loves dessert so she ordered one for each of us.... I ordered a Chimay and they brought and poured me a Duvel.  No complaints from me but, heyo?

The creme brulee was good to excellent.  Vanilla beans on the bottom and all.  Snappy and not too eggy with a strawberry garnish.  

The Chocolate mousse was excellent.  I took one bite of it and the whole meal pretty much kicked in and I was KO'ed for the night.  I slept so good after this meal.  Better than I had in a long time.  That says a lot.  I will be back for sure to try their brunch maybe.  The photos of the Steak with a slice of foie look incredible.  

With tip we easily spent over $200 eating like royalty.  

I will be back for the $22 prix fix chefs choice menu for sure as well.  Good value I would have to think for this level of food.

excerpts: May I suggest changing to
" Sugar and Spice's" favorite!

Ratatouille, mild yet flavorful marinara sauce with grilled bell peppers, a little aubergines added perhaps, served over 2 perfectly poached eggs set in the center of 2 halved English muffin, which have been drizzled with ratatouille.
Savoring every bite.........................
.author: Michelle A.
.review:
So, Yelped brunch and stumbled upon this little Bistro, hidden by Chestnut area. Really hidden, thanks to y'all Yelpers I found my favorite little French Bistro in I left my heart in San Francisco. 

We sat outside not minding the light chill or wispy mist sometimes drops of rain would gently tap the canopy above our wobbly table, just like in France. 

Evian to start out with, followed by: 

Oeufs Baker Street Bistro (Dave's favorite) Who is Dave? 
and why does he get his name on as HIS 
favorite? :)  May I suggest changing to  " Sugar and Spice's" favorite! ;)

If I were an Oeufs, I would have found my soul-mate Baker street Bistro. 
Ratatouille, mild yet flavorful marinara sauce with grilled bell peppers, a little aubergines added perhaps, served over 2 perfectly poached eggs set in the center of 2 halved English muffin, which have been drizzled with ratatouille.  Savoring every bite.........................yummmmmyyyyyyy

I can brunch here every Sunday! 

Brunching while watching the working girls go by.... should be a song.

.author: Rose L.
.review:
It was my first time trying this place yesterday. Here's what we've tried so far:

1.  1/2 Dozen Escargot (Decent)
2.  1/2 Dozen Oysters (Great)
3. Foie Gras (Great)
4. Lamb Chops (The meat was cooked perfectly but lacking flavors/spices) 
5. Lamb Stew (The meat was sooo tender and soft, just needed a little more salt, which was an easy fix)

I would come back to try their brunch menu and their duck leg for dinner. Aside for their food lacking a little flavor/spice/salt, their customer service were superb.

excerpts: We really wanted to love this place.
From the time we walked in, it made such a warm impression: such a cozy and causal, family-style bistro where the staff welcomes you with a smile.
In terms of service and ambience, it was definitely 4 stars but in terms of food, it was more like 2.
Everything we had from the French onion soup and goat cheese salad to the lamb chops were a disappointment, just bland and unimpressive.
Not worth returning, just too much below par but because of the terrific service, I have to round out my rating to 3 stars.
.author: Saminda W.
.review: We really wanted to love this place.  From the time we walked in, it made such a warm impression: such a cozy and causal, family-style bistro where the staff welcomes you with a smile.  In terms of service and ambience, it was definitely 4 stars but in terms of food, it was more like 2.  Everything we had from the French onion soup and goat cheese salad to the lamb chops were a disappointment, just bland and unimpressive.  Not worth returning, just too much below par but because of the terrific service, I have to round out my rating to 3 stars.

excerpts: Menu designed by Frenchman, executed by a Central American.
Out of party of 4, 2 of us sent our main courses back.
Excellent server totally understood and sympathized.
She is only reason I am giving 2 stars instead of 1.
None of us will ever go back.
.author: Aloysius D.
