excerpts: I have been to this place twice and LOVED it both times.
The food is great, but more importantly, the owner and staff are some of the sweetest people I have yet to meet in San Francisco.
The atmosphere lends itself to a little romance or good times for a large crowd.
The menu changes seasonally.
I liked my mussels - nice white wine broth and yummy french fries and loved the salmon dish.
I am always too full to try dessert, but they sure look good!!
.author: Kamael S.
.review: I have been to this place twice and LOVED it both times.  The food is great, but more importantly, the owner and staff are some of the sweetest people I have yet to meet in San Francisco.  The atmosphere lends itself to a little romance or good times for a large crowd.  The menu changes seasonally.  I liked my mussels - nice white wine broth and yummy french fries and loved the salmon dish.  I am always too full to try dessert, but they sure look good!!

excerpts: One of the best steals in town.
The $15 fixed price dinner menu is awesome.
.author: Wendy L.
.review: One of the best steals in town.  The $15 fixed price dinner menu is awesome.

excerpts: This neighborhood bistro is the best in SF!
The food is superb especially the cassoulet, French onion soup, and all the trimmings.
The atmosphere is inviting and warm.
The service is with personal touch and personality.
We love Bakers Street Bistro and will return often.
.author: Sbh H.
.review: This neighborhood bistro is the best in SF!  The food is superb especially the cassoulet, French onion soup, and all the trimmings. The atmosphere is inviting and warm. The service is with personal touch and personality. We love Bakers Street Bistro and will return often.

excerpts: Over 10 minutes later, I went back inside to tell her that we would be fine sitting outside,  but that we were hungry.
She said OK, but was distracted (because she was also a server).
We went back to waiting outside.
There were a few tables available and had I been functioning, I would have just sat in one, but I wasn't, so we continued to wait outside.
Another server (male with a friendly smile) came over to us and asked us if we had been helped.
I explained and he offered us a seat.
She took our order  without writing anything down and was very sweet.
They did not refill the coffee until I specifically asked for it.
And then, the coffee she used to refill my cup with caffeinated.
Besides that, I liked that they had Benedict options (some vegetarian) and parking was not too hard to find.
I do wish though that they had had a vegan dish or two and not charged so many extra fees for the eggs.
Omlette was something like 8 dollars, egg whites was an additional 1.50, cheese .75, and onions
I felt nickle and dimed.
Plus, they claimed they only had Swiss cheese
but I saw them give my friend parm cheese for her Caesar salad.
Nice touches:
-They did not give us salt and pepper;  had to reach over to the unoccupied table next to us to get it.
I would go there again, but  perhaps for dinner?
It was nice to go to a place so close to the Presidio but not quite in it.
.author: Abi W.
.review:
We didn't have reservations. I did not know that we needed any. The place was half full at the outside patio, all full inside the rstaurant when we got there and by the time we sat down, the outside patio was almost empty. 

It took forever to be seated, We told the staff member (female) that we preferred inside because it was chilly outside. She took our name and asked us to wait outside. OK, the restaurant is small but still, it was chilly. Over 10 minutes later, I went back inside to tell her that we would be fine sitting outside,  but that we were hungry. She said OK, but was distracted (because she was also a server). We went back to waiting outside. There were a few tables available and had I been functioning, I would have just sat in one, but I wasn't, so we continued to wait outside. Another server (male with a friendly smile) came over to us and asked us if we had been helped. I explained and he offered us a seat. We sat down, only to have the first server (female) apologize for the confusion and try to clean off our table for us. 

Eventually someone who I would assume was an owner (female, dressed professionally, French speaker). She took our order  without writing anything down and was very sweet. She and her male server also helped us to push the wasp away from our table when it hovered around us. 

The food was pretty good. I had an egg white omlette with Swiss cheese and onions and a decaf coffee. They did not refill the coffee until I specifically asked for it.  And then, the coffee she used to refill my cup with caffeinated. Besides that, I liked that they had Benedict options (some vegetarian) and parking was not too hard to find. I do wish though that they had had a vegan dish or two and not charged so many extra fees for the eggs. Omlette was something like 8 dollars, egg whites was an additional 1.50, cheese .75, and onions .75.  I felt nickle and dimed. Plus, they claimed they only had Swiss cheese but I saw them give my friend parm cheese for her Caesar salad.  
 
Nice touches:
-Warm milk was served with the decaf
-cute outside patio 
-they offered ketchup (I declined)

Not-so-nice touches
-They did not give us sugar or substitutes, I had to reach over to the unoccupied table next to us to get it.
-They did not give us salt and pepper;  had to reach over to the unoccupied table next to us to get it.

All in all, I was glad to be there because it meant that I was spending time with my close friends. I would go there again, but  perhaps for dinner? It was nice to go to a place so close to the Presidio but not quite in it.

excerpts: What a cozy, romantic, and friendly little French bistro.
.author: Claire Y.
.review:
What a cozy, romantic, and friendly little French bistro.  The prix-fix dinner menu is a great deal for some kickass French food.   

The profiterole was totally orgasmic.....

excerpts: A quaint neighborhood bistro that has such good value!
They were playing some French oldies when we were there.
We ordered one prix fixe dinner which had a simple salad, nice black bean soup, an entree which was salmon and creme caramel for dessert (around $17).
Is that awesome value or what?!
I got one entree (seafood stew) and dessert.
We both got a glass of wine and the tab came out to be around $60!
The food was pretty good too.
If I lived in the area, I'd definitely be a regular.
Otherwise, parking isn't that great in the area.
Don't expect fancy decor or anything, but if you want a low key dinner at a cozy bistro, this is a good place..
.author: Pelina C.
.review:
A quaint neighborhood bistro that has such good value!  They were playing some French oldies when we were there.  
We ordered one prix fixe dinner which had a simple salad, nice black bean soup, an entree which was salmon and creme caramel for dessert (around $17).  Is that awesome value or what?!  I got one entree (seafood stew) and dessert.  We both got a glass of wine and the tab came out to be around $60!  The food was pretty good too.  If I lived in the area, I'd definitely be a regular.  Otherwise, parking isn't that great in the area.  Don't expect fancy decor or anything, but if you want a low key dinner at a cozy bistro, this is a good place..

excerpts:
The first thought on our minds after we parked the car (yes, we drove) - was "why is everything French themed?!" 

Needless to say, we walked up to the bistro and was greeted by none other than a French man, with a real French accent.
" he proclaimed.
As we walked in the door, a table had just opened by the window and they were clearing the evidence from the last party's visit.
We sit down, and ordered mimosas (yes, thanks to my lead!)
My waiter corrected me in the way I said "frittata" - he kept pronouncing it fri-TA-TA.... so I gave up trying to be butcher the little French that I knew.
We ordered the ham and cheese on a baguette, an omelet, and the French Toast.
It wasn't GREAT
but it wasn't not great...
just as Holly would put it  - "meh".
It just felt like a very slow experience.
No one was in a hurry... then again, maybe this is how the French live.
.author: Lisa L.
.review:
The first thought on our minds after we parked the car (yes, we drove) - was "why is everything French themed?!" 

Needless to say, we walked up to the bistro and was greeted by none other than a French man, with a real French accent.  "BONJOUR!" he proclaimed.  As we walked in the door, a table had just opened by the window and they were clearing the evidence from the last party's visit.  We sit down, and ordered mimosas (yes, thanks to my lead!) and then sat... and sat... and sat.  

My waiter corrected me in the way I said "frittata" - he kept pronouncing it fri-TA-TA.... so I gave up trying to be butcher the little French that I knew.  We ordered the ham and cheese on a baguette, an omelet, and the French Toast.  It wasn't GREAT but it wasn't not great... just as Holly would put it  - "meh". 

It just felt like a very slow experience.  No one was in a hurry... then again, maybe this is how the French live.  I am too busy running around in my San Franciscan lifestyle, where as the French just lounge and say, "d'accord". 

D'accord. Au Revoir!

excerpts: True, it is not quite the exquisite French cuisine, however, you don't pay the price either.
We order the prix fixe, the tomato soup was tasty, not too creamy, we liked it.
The main course was like a beef stew, can't recall the name, it was delicious but more like home cooking.
The green salad was fresh however quite ordinary.
The desert.was the bread pudding, it was good but again more like home cooking.
It was good value, we will go back,.
.author: jen j.
.review: True, it is not quite the exquisite French cuisine, however, you don't pay the price either.  We order the prix fixe, the tomato soup was tasty, not too creamy, we liked it.  The main course was like a beef stew, can't recall the name, it was delicious but more like home cooking.  The green salad was fresh however quite ordinary.  The desert.was the bread pudding, it was good but again more like home cooking.  It was good value, we will go back,.

excerpts: Yes I am a very big fan;)
A- they have chateau neuf du pape.
Always an excellent and solid wine choice!!!
B- the seafood 'stew' if I may be so gauche to call it
that was lovely.
Although I thought the scallops could be a touch more tender, this was still amazing.
My gentleman friend had the steak and a monster piece of foie gras on top.
I am in love.
I love foie gras and on top of steak w/ delicious ratatouille on the side.
Escargot always on point.
This place is very quiet and off the beaten path, so this is love.
No one bugs you,
no screaming children and everyone speaks French.
Yes I have arrived!!
Baker St. Bistro I shall be back!!
.author: Nicole F.
.review:
Yes I am a very big fan;)  A- they have chateau neuf du pape.  Always an excellent and solid wine choice!!! B- the seafood 'stew' if I may be so gauche to call it that was lovely.  Although I thought the scallops could be a touch more tender, this was still amazing.  My gentleman friend had the steak and a monster piece of foie gras on top.  I am in love.  I love foie gras and on top of steak w/ delicious ratatouille on the side.  Child please, let me die now!!!

Escargot always on point.  This place is very quiet and off the beaten path, so this is love.  No one bugs you, no screaming children and everyone speaks French.  Yes I have arrived!!  Baker St. Bistro I shall be back!!

excerpts: Went here for brunch on the weekend and really enjoyed the food.
I wish there were a bit more variety in terms of the food options but I ordered the goat cheese salad with tomato vinaigrette and it was delicious.
.author: Ella E.
.review: Went here for brunch on the weekend and really enjoyed the food.  I wish there were a bit more variety in terms of the food options but I ordered the goat cheese salad with tomato vinaigrette and it was delicious.

excerpts: ...  Is it true that Cow Hollow is hard to navigate and find?
I bring family and out of town visitors here for a good meal, shoulder to shoulder and toe to toe but the meal and atmosphere are great!
I have Always had a great dining experience here, great meal and never a bad one.
This is a cuisine, not just food, and the choice of wines and the desserts make for a really good time.
.author: Joe J.
.review:
Navigating Lombard without dangerous situations... an oxymoron... slowing down to find and turn onto Baker Street... whoops, turn on the next one and nose about a bit to find some parking... Look, a spot On Lombard!...  Is it true that Cow Hollow is hard to navigate and find?  ;-) 

I bring family and out of town visitors here for a good meal, shoulder to shoulder and toe to toe but the meal and atmosphere are great!  And in the occasional good weather there is small outdoor seating.  

I have Always had a great dining experience here, great meal and never a bad one.  This is a cuisine, not just food, and the choice of wines and the desserts make for a really good time.

excerpts: They must have cranked up the burners in the kitchen since then.
Our entrees were (in descending debacle order) scorched, dried out, dehydrated.
We started with dry, flavorless risotto and duck that was about as overdone as I have seen.
After sending the risotto back (it was the worse of the two), we got scorched scallops - waitress' response?
"they are burned.
It is because of the sauce."
We thought she was shockingly indifferent to our clear unhappiness with the meal, but then she surprised us with a desert on the house.
So sad that the reality does not line up with my fond memories.
we won't be going back
.author: Pavel F.
.review:
Was not expecting Cajun...

I remember many years ago going to this cute bistro and considering it a "find."   Romantic, good food, wallet friendly prices.   They must have cranked up the burners in the kitchen since then.  Our entrees were (in descending debacle order) scorched, dried out, dehydrated.  We started with dry, flavorless risotto and duck that was about as overdone as I have seen.  After sending the risotto back (it was the worse of the two), we got scorched scallops - waitress' response?  "they are burned.  It is because of the sauce."  All I could think was - did ya ever think about using a different sauce??  

We thought she was shockingly indifferent to our clear unhappiness with the meal, but then she surprised us with a desert on the house.  Nice touch (saved them from the single star), but not enough. 

So sad that the reality does not line up with my fond memories.  we won't be going back

excerpts: I walked out of the restaurant with a full and satisfied feeling in my stomach
.author: Will C.
.review:
Was here in the Marina for a runner friend's birthday and we had a group birthday dinner. At the end of the night I can say I was not disappointed at all with (a) the food, (b) the service and (c) the atmosphere. The menu selection did appear somewhat limited but hey sometimes change isn't necessary? I walked out of the restaurant with a full and satisfied feeling in my stomach  :)

My dish consisted of: chardonnay wine, soup of the day, duck Breast with potenta, braised fennel, orange Bigarrade (fabulous entree by the way!), more wine, one slice of creme brule and some champagne.

At some point I may go back to this place and try their Sunday brunch after a morning road bike ride into Sausalito/Tiburon.

Good times, thanks Dan for introducing me to this place!

excerpts: We were immediately seated outside at one of  the sidewalk tables after being given a choice of that or one of the inside tables.
Although my quick look inside indicated that it was quite inviting in there, we opted to eat outside on such a beautiful morning.
.author: Rob S.
.review:
We met some friends at the Baker Street Bistro for Sunday brunch and it was a wonderful experience! We were immediately seated outside at one of  the sidewalk tables after being given a choice of that or one of the inside tables. Although my quick look inside indicated that it was quite inviting in there, we opted to eat outside on such a beautiful morning. This table availability is worth noting as it was 11:00AM on a Sunday, and one of our friends who had walked up Chestnut noted that many of the "regular" places had crowds waiting out front. 

Now to the food; it was simply delicious! I got to taste the croque monsieur, the french toast and the risotto, as well as having eggs florentine myself. The croque monsieur and the french toast with creme fraiche were both sinful for lack of a better description! The french toast was thick but very light and fluffy. I'm sure it had absorbed pointy of butter, combined with he creme fraiche and what I think was a light raspberry sauce made me feel more like I was eating a warm pastry. I only had one bite of my friend's croque monsieur, but that was enough for me to question having ordered anything else. I did also enjoy my eggs florentine as the eggs were cooked perfectly and the sauce was rich and delicious and the spinach was plentiful.

We went expecting a simple cafe/bistro experience, and that is exactly what we got, along with great food and a pleasant and attentive waitress.

If you are looking for a simple, delicious brunch in the marina, but don't want to deal with crowds, then this is the place!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I went here on a Sunday afternoon in late November, after finishing a run at Crissy field.
We were seated right away
and I was excited to have potentially found a new neighborhood gem.
The decor inside was cute, and the staff was friendly and efficient.
However, when my french toast arrived it was super greasy and served with FAKE maple syrup.
Doesn't everyone knew that REAL maple syrup is better?!
But OH, the kicker was the creme-not-so-fraiche.
UG.
It tasted so vile to me, like it was spoiled.
I paid for those two bites of bad creme fraiche the next day...
I became nauseous at work that morning and puked (literally had to RUN down the hall).
I then went home sick and puked again that afternoon.
I had to call out sick the following day because my stomach hurt so bad.
This was definitely food poisoning.
I barely made my flight to Hawaii that Wednesday morning, and was subpar that whole week.
Yes, Baker Street Bistro nearly ruined my birthday vacation and I will never be back.
.author: Amy B.
.review: I really wanted to like this place. My boyfriend and I went here on a Sunday afternoon in late November, after finishing a run at Crissy field.  We were seated right away and I was excited to have potentially found a new neighborhood gem.  The decor inside was cute, and the staff was friendly and efficient.  However, when my french toast arrived it was super greasy and served with FAKE maple syrup.  Doesn't everyone knew that REAL maple syrup is better?! But OH, the kicker was the creme-not-so-fraiche.  UG. It tasted so vile to me, like it was spoiled.  I paid for those two bites of bad creme fraiche the next day...I became nauseous at work that morning and puked (literally had to RUN down the hall).  I then went home sick and puked again that afternoon.  I had to call out sick the following day because my stomach hurt so bad.  This was definitely food poisoning.  I barely made my flight to Hawaii that Wednesday morning, and was subpar that whole week.  Yes, Baker Street Bistro nearly ruined my birthday vacation and I will never be back.

excerpts: Food is amazing, service is wonderful, and the chef/owners are really incredible.
When I was there last year, we had the bouillabaisse, quail with risotto, lamb chops, and profiteroles, and "peppered strawberries"- all delicious.
I still remember every bite and cannot wait to go back!
.author: Amanda S.
.review: I live in Chicago and would come to San Fran just to eat at this restaurant. Food is amazing, service is wonderful, and the chef/owners are really incredible.  When I was there last year, we had the bouillabaisse, quail with risotto, lamb chops, and profiteroles, and "peppered strawberries"- all delicious.  I still remember every bite and cannot wait to go back!

excerpts: The place is rather small, so it's not good for large groups, but it's perfect for an intimate dining experience with just a few people.
.author: Peter B.
.review:
This is a cozy, charming little bistro with fantastic food at very reasonable prices. The waitstaff is authentically French (minus the attitude), and the owner is quite friendly. This place is great for either brunch or dinner, and is especially good for romantic meals or dates. 

The place is rather small, so it's not good for large groups, but it's perfect for an intimate dining experience with just a few people.  There's also sidewalk dining available, which is perfect for brunch on a sunny day. 

The kitchen is tiny, which makes it even more amazing that they can produce such quality food. And their prices are quite reasonable, especially considering the quality. All in all, you can't go wrong with this gem.

excerpts: Great place.
Like previous posters said, the service here is incredibly friendly, especially if you get the manager to come out and chat at your table.
Every wine suggestion I've been given here has been spot-on, and they make a point to suggest wines that are a little bit out of the ordinary (ones that you probably wouldn't order on your own).
The food is pretty good as well, although not completely orgasmic.
Very solid french fare, especially the mussels (just be sure to get them with pommes frites to dip in the wine sauce).
In fact, every seafood dish I've gotten here was excellent, and their creme brulee is incredibly creamy and smooth.
I liked this place so much that I ate here with my family and a few friends for my college graduation dinner and everyone,
even my cheap parents, left happy and satisfied.
.author: Dana B.
.review:
Great place.  Like previous posters said, the service here is incredibly friendly, especially if you get the manager to come out and chat at your table.  Every wine suggestion I've been given here has been spot-on, and they make a point to suggest wines that are a little bit out of the ordinary (ones that you probably wouldn't order on your own).  
The food is pretty good as well, although not completely orgasmic.  Very solid french fare, especially the mussels (just be sure to get them with pommes frites to dip in the wine sauce).  In fact, every seafood dish I've gotten here was excellent, and their creme brulee is incredibly creamy and smooth. 
I liked this place so much that I ate here with my family and a few friends for my college graduation dinner and everyone, even my cheap parents, left happy and satisfied.

excerpts: ass delicious French toast.
That's all.
Very good.
.author: Ashley S.
.review:
Caveat: I get the same thing everytime I go, and it's their killer kick ass delicious French toast.  That's all.  Very good.  Very big portion.  

Dings for no bacon, and for saying "fresh-squeezed orange juice" when its just Odwalla.

excerpts: Came here for a dinner party on a Friday night at 7:30 and found the restaurant it to be partially filled.
I ordered the mixed greens and duck confit.
The mixed greens had an appropriate amount of dressing and the duck confit was tender but the sauce was not as tasty as expected.
The food was ok but not something I can get excited about.
I'm curious about brunch since everyone raves about it
but I'd rather check out other places in the city first since this one doesn't seem to stand out.
The atmosphere is cozy but very cramped.
Strange to say but the restroom seems literally bigger than our table of six.
The service was excellent.
I'd say this place would be better off for tourists because of its cozy feel and its close proximity to Palace of Fine Arts.
.author: Luna L.
.review: Came here for a dinner party on a Friday night at 7:30 and found the restaurant it to be partially filled.  I ordered the mixed greens and duck confit. The mixed greens had an appropriate amount of dressing and the duck confit was tender but the sauce was not as tasty as expected. The food was ok but not something I can get excited about. I'm curious about brunch since everyone raves about it but I'd rather check out other places in the city first since this one doesn't seem to stand out. The atmosphere is cozy but very cramped. Strange to say but the restroom seems literally bigger than our table of six. The service was excellent. I'd say this place would be better off for tourists because of its cozy feel and its close proximity to Palace of Fine Arts.

excerpts: BTW, they screwed up the Cream Brulee, it is eggy and watery  loose.
Very amaterish....
Try Chouchou in Forest hill.
, it is worth to die for...
.author: Bob W.
.review:
Cutting to the chase, best to avoid if you are looking for true French cuisine. But acceptable for tourist quality level and a quick fix.
This restaurant was recommended by a man friend, a mistake.
The ambience is fine with French speaking waiters, but not real french type. Parking is very difficult and be there early. The bread is soft and chewy, more Italian than French bread. Onion soup is lightly salted with Rose Mary-Bay leaves flavored. Excessive Mozzarella cheese on top. Froie Grois is bland and Sauce is not as flavorful, the accompanied Figs are done to perfection. Looks like the Chefs are changing again here. Steak Frites is average at best, chewy and no flavor. Stay away from the Mussel, it is fouled flavor and the soup has a stinky scent and taste. becareful with gettign sick.
I don't think I am coming back again. BTW, they screwed up the Cream Brulee, it is eggy and watery  loose. Very amaterish....
Try Chouchou in Forest hill., it is worth to die for...

excerpts: I really liked the atmosphere, the service was good, and the food was delicious.
The problem was the portion size.
I had the halibut for $30.
This consisted of about a 3" cube of halibut placed on a type of vegetable puree.
Great tasting, but for $30 it can't just taste good
, it has got to leave you at least somewhat satisfied.
I could have eaten three servings  no probem.
I' m 6 feet tall and 180lb
, so it's not like I'm expecting an all-you-can-eat buffet.
My friend got the Salmon for $24, same problem, but at least she had ordered a side salad (not included with the meal).

excerpts: This is a wonderful neighborhood place, cozy and quaint.
The first time I was here, smoke came out of the kitchen, a firetruck pulled up, firemen came in, all the customers clapped and continued eating.
Nothing was on fire, but no one cared.
Another time, I saw some guy in a convertible pulled up, gave the owner an empty plate, thanked him in French and drove off like we're in sidewalk cafe in Europe.
It was a doggy bag from the night before and he got take the real plate home.
.author: cc c.
.review:
This is a wonderful neighborhood place, cozy and quaint.  The first time I was here, smoke came out of the kitchen, a firetruck pulled up, firemen came in, all the customers clapped and continued eating.  Nothing was on fire, but no one cared.  That's customer loyalty

Another time, I saw some guy in a convertible pulled up, gave the owner an empty plate, thanked him in French and drove off like we're in sidewalk cafe in Europe.  It was a doggy bag from the night before and he got take the real plate home.

excerpts: It was the best i've had in my life, even better than Mama's!
The strawberry creme fraiche was amazing.
Also had the poached egg with ratatouille, which was great as well.
.author: Jennifer R.
.review: You have to get their specialty french toast. It was the best i've had in my life, even better than Mama's!  The strawberry creme fraiche was amazing. Also had the poached egg with ratatouille, which was great as well. Fresh squeezed orange juice topped it all off with a delicious finish. But you just have to get the french toast. You won't be disappointed!

excerpts: We had light dinner - salads as a main course, wine, dessert and some tea.
Everything was tasty' and the service was o.k.
Greta atmosphere!
.author: michelle k.
.review: We had light dinner - salads as a main course, wine, dessert and some tea.  Everything was tasty' and the service was o.k. Greta atmosphere!

excerpts: brunch today in the city.
Love the French toast, served with fresh fruit salad.
It was too sweet for my friend, but I love it.
she had eggs Benedict , came with a small salad.
I wanted to see the dinner menu, asked for it twice,never got it.
Not  a big deal, I could read it on Yelp,  One crucial point for me: clean and spacious unisex bathroom.
parking is a pain, so drop off your party to grab a table, then go park.
good luck.

excerpts: I was really disappointed with this place.
After reading so many glowing Yelp reviews, I had lofty expectations of a mind-blowing brunch and great service.
The second I walked in, I was confused.
Do I seat myself?
No one looked up to even acknowledge my presence.
I arrived 10 minutes ahead of a friend.
The second he sat down, a server pounced on us to order.
When we asked for a few more minutes, we got a nasty look and about 30 seconds.
I understand that this is a small place and that the weekend brunch crowd is critical for their business.
But the key to keeping customers coming back is quality service.
As the food was totally underwhelming, I'll doubt I'll ever be back.
.author: Lindsay M.
.review:
I was really disappointed with this place.  After reading so many glowing Yelp reviews, I had lofty expectations of a mind-blowing brunch and great service.  Instead, I had a mushy piece of french toast and received extremely poor treatment.  

The second I walked in, I was confused.  Do I seat myself?  No one looked up to even acknowledge my presence.  Once shoved into a tiny corner table, it took over 5 minutes to get a menu.

I arrived 10 minutes ahead of a friend.  The second he sat down, a server pounced on us to order.  When we asked for a few more minutes, we got a nasty look and about 30 seconds.  Then another server came over and demanded that we order.

I understand that this is a small place and that the weekend brunch crowd is critical for their business.  But the key to keeping customers coming back is quality service.  As the food was totally underwhelming, I'll doubt I'll ever be back.

excerpts: It's been awhile since I've wandered over to Baker Street Bistro so last weekend we were in the market for brunch/lunch.
It was Fleet Week but since the Blue Angels got fogged out, BSB wasn't crowded when we arrived a little after 2PM.
As others have said, the Croque Madame was fabulous!
The egg was perfectly cooked and the bread was toasted on both sides (something you don't find in France).
BF had an egg white omelete that had tons of mushrooms and spinach.
We split an order of french fries which were hot and crispy.
The house white by the glass was a little on the sweet side.
But I was so into my Croque that I didn't care!
I'm planning a return trip soon!
For those not in the neighborhood, while this place seems off the main Marina track, it's very convenient to the #30, 43 and 28.
.author: Melissa A.
.review:
It's been awhile since I've wandered over to Baker Street Bistro so last weekend we were in the market for brunch/lunch.  It was Fleet Week but since the Blue Angels got fogged out, BSB wasn't crowded when we arrived a little after 2PM.  
As others have said, the Croque Madame was fabulous!  The egg was perfectly cooked and the bread was toasted on both sides (something you don't find in France).  BF had an egg white omelete that had tons of mushrooms and spinach.  We split an order of french fries which were hot and crispy.  
The house white by the glass was a little on the sweet side.  But I was so into my Croque that I didn't care!  I'm planning a return trip soon!
For those not in the neighborhood, while this place seems off the main Marina track, it's very convenient to the #30, 43 and 28.

excerpts: birthday:-)
I myself had the French toast which was so so good!!!
Presentation was just as good as it tastes!
It came with a good variety of fresh fruits too which was a plus for me.
My sister had the mussels with French fries.
It was a huge portion..so much she shared with the table.
The French fries stayed crispy all the way to the end!
I don't like soggy fries so this gets an extra star!
My friends had the eggs benedict with smoked salmon, and the one with ratatouille.
They didn't really like the potatoes that came with it..
i tasted it and it was dry and had a heavy herb and olive oil taste to it.
Well, its not the kind I like.
And bf had the Croque Madame which looked
oh so good.
He finished the whole thing which was a good sign!
He loves Swiss cheese and it was melted just the right way:-)
One thing was I looked around at all the other tables
and they got bread and butter without requesting.
We were the only one with no bread to start off with!
I'm a total bread whore!
So I need my bread!!!!
I had to request it.
But my friends were annoyed by it and said they were racist.
Lol:-D
An extra extra star for not charging us the cake fee but just thought it was odd
they charged us gratuity when it's just five of us.
I always thought it was six or more.
We brought a stuffed Domo with us..
did that count???
.author: Betty L.
.review: Came here for Sunday Brunch for me and my sis birthday:-)  I myself had the French toast which was so so good!!! Presentation was just as good as it tastes! It came with a good variety of fresh fruits too which was a plus for me.  My sister had the mussels with French fries. It was a huge portion..so much she shared with the table. The French fries stayed crispy all the way to the end! I don't like soggy fries so this gets an extra star!  My friends had the eggs benedict with smoked salmon, and the one with ratatouille.  They didn't really like the potatoes that came with it..i tasted it and it was dry and had a heavy herb and olive oil taste to it.  Well, its not the kind I like.  And bf had the Croque Madame which looked oh so good. He finished the whole thing which was a good sign!  He loves Swiss cheese and it was melted just the right way:-)  One thing was I looked around at all the other tables and they got bread and butter without requesting.  We were the only one with no bread to start off with!  I'm a total bread whore! So I need my bread!!!! I had to request it.  But my friends were annoyed by it and said they were racist. Lol:-D An extra extra star for not charging us the cake fee but just thought it was odd they charged us gratuity when it's just five of us. I always thought it was six or more.  We brought a stuffed Domo with us..did that count???

excerpts: FOOD IS YUMMY.
SALAD AND HALIBUT TRULY EXCELLENT.
SERVICE IS AT BEST
"HIT AND MISS".
ALSO, TRULY LACKED WARMTH AND FRIENDLINESS.
I don't care if you are French and have excellent food.
Note:
We were 2 females:
Dessert - - skip.
Had the profiteroles and ice cream - - and it really was not that good.
Not worth the calories.
When I went to ask the chef what the Fixed price menu consisted of, rather than answering my question, he opened the menu and pointed his finger at it.
RUDE.
I didn't get upset or display any negative stuff, though.
Wait person (female) was nice enough to start, but FORGOT to bring us a bread basket during our meal and FORGOT to bring me a glass of wine during the meal.
I noticed the waitress "fawning" over an older couple, and basically, giving me bare-bones service.
I had to wait for lemon for water.
I ordered a second glass of wine during the middle of my meal,  which she just forgot to bring.
Okay.
Did not get upset, just noticed the sub-standard service.
Again, dessert is not worth it.
Tasted bland and like the profiterole was stale.
NOW, UPON REFLECTION, I REALIZE THAT
IT IS UNIVERSAL THAT NOTHING
So, that being the case, better to order something else.
WHEN WE LEFT THE RESTAURANT, NO ONE SAID
A
"Thank you".
All of the little touches were LEFT OUT, and contributed to make the experience less than warm and enjoyable.
THE FOOD IS GOOD, THOUGH.
THE ENTREE WAS TRULY, TRULY, YUMMY, AND
SO WAS THE SALAD.
.author: Diane F.
.review:
Dinner for 2 on Wednesday, November 3, 2010.  
FOOD IS YUMMY.  SALAD AND HALIBUT TRULY EXCELLENT.  SERVICE IS AT BEST "HIT AND MISS".  This evening it was mostly MISS.

ALSO, TRULY LACKED WARMTH AND FRIENDLINESS.  I don't care if you are French and have excellent food.  Be polite!

Note:  We were 2 females:  Polite we were - - I guarantee you.

Dessert - - skip.  Had the profiteroles and ice cream - - and it really was not that good.  Not worth the calories.  SERVICE PRETTY MUCH SUCKED UPON REFLECTION.  

Would have gladly tipped MORE than 15% IF SERVICE HAD BEEN BETTER.

I was greeted in a friendly enough manner by waitress when I first entered restaurant.  

When I went to ask the chef what the Fixed price menu consisted of, rather than answering my question, he opened the menu and pointed his finger at it.  RUDE.  I didn't get upset or display any negative stuff, though.  I just sat down and read the menu.  

I still had to wait for my friend to arrive, and she was driving over from Oakland specifically to meet me at this restaurant.  

Wait person (female) was nice enough to start, but FORGOT to bring us a bread basket during our meal and FORGOT to bring me a glass of wine during the meal.  RESTAURANT WAS NOT CROWDED AT ALL, so being overly busy not adequate excuse/reason.

I noticed the waitress "fawning" over an older couple, and basically, giving me bare-bones service.  I had to wait for lemon for water.  She eventually brought it, though it seemed like a really long wait for something so simple, and there was only 2 other people in the restaurant at the time besides me.

I ordered a second glass of wine during the middle of my meal,  which she just forgot to bring.  Okay.  Did not get upset, just noticed the sub-standard service.  Very slow as well.  

Again, dessert is not worth it.  Tasted bland and like the profiterole was stale.  NOW, UPON REFLECTION, I REALIZE THAT IT IS UNIVERSAL THAT NOTHING IS FRESHLY BAKED ON A WEDNESDAY.  

So, that being the case, better to order something else.  WHEN WE LEFT THE RESTAURANT, NO ONE SAID A "Thank you".  All of the little touches were LEFT OUT, and contributed to make the experience less than warm and enjoyable.  THE FOOD IS GOOD, THOUGH.  THE ENTREE WAS TRULY, TRULY, YUMMY, AND SO WAS THE SALAD.

excerpts: OK, the atmosphere is charming - gotta love the neighborhood bistro.
The food and service, however...
The steak quality is questionable.
Sure, with rich sauces it tastes better, but i ordered my FILET with the morel sauce on the side and ... chewy gristle much?
Service was very ...
French.
I ordered a glass of wine, after starting with water, and the waiter acted like he was doing me a favor getting it for me.
Didnt even stay around long enough to see if my dinner companion wanted a glass ... of anything!
Similarly, one water glass was refilled - the other?
Couldnt be bothered.
If you're packed and serving quality food, I might overlook the occasional empty water glass but on a Sunday night with all of 4 tables full - unacceptable!
Pull it together, Baker St Bistro.
I want to love you!

The best thing there was the escargot, fries and walnut encrusted goat cheese salad.
Everything else was bland and needed to be tasted by the chef/cooks.
Too bad.
I really had high hopes.

excerpts:
Like a Paris sidewalk bistro

This place pulls it off, you'd think you had just stepped off the street in Paris.
We had the meat and cheese plate (very good) and the croque monsier.
It was just like one from Paris...
it was buttery and crunchy and just felt decadent.
Probably not health food...
.author: nunov y.
.review:
Like a Paris sidewalk bistro

This place pulls it off, you'd think you had just stepped off the street in Paris.  We went here for lunch, and sat outside on a very nice day.

We had the meat and cheese plate (very good) and the croque monsier.  It was just like one from Paris...it was buttery and crunchy and just felt decadent.  Probably not health food...but oh well.

Even the pomme frite (french fries) we bought for the little one were some of the best I've had.

Two thumbs up...visit this place soon!

http://www.theholstory.blogspot.com/

excerpts: but I was impressed.
Eggs over easy perfectly done-ie eggs were still runny-,
yummy potatoes and all you can eat baguette.
The owner is very French and very charming.
The prints of Paris that grace the walls make you feel like you're in a tiny Parisian bistro.
.author: Amber L.
.review: I have only had the pleasure of experiencing breakfast here but I was impressed.  Eggs over easy perfectly done-ie eggs were still runny-, yummy potatoes and all you can eat baguette.  The owner is very French and very charming.  The prints of Paris that grace the walls make you feel like you're in a tiny Parisian bistro.

excerpts: after the heart wrenching film 'la vie en rose,' about french chanteuse edith piaf, my dear friend and i wanted to keep the french theme going well into dinner.
i love a good prix fixe menu, and on sunday evenings at BBB, it lasts all night.

delicious creme of asparagus soup, a large bone in pork chop with reduction, creamy mashed potatoes, a small mixed green salad, and the most delightful chocolate pot-au-creme for dessert.  for $16.50.
also great for weekend brunch.
they do an excellent eggs benedict.
the hollandaise sauce is light and delicate, not heavy and oily.
homemade pate with petit cornichons  is always good.
service can sometimes be spotty, but i chalk it up the the french atmosphere, and try to enjoy it.
.author: Mimi G.
.review:
after the heart wrenching film 'la vie en rose,' about french chanteuse edith piaf, my dear friend and i wanted to keep the french theme going well into dinner.  we decided to swing by baker street bistro, an old favorite and an always solid standard.

i love a good prix fixe menu, and on sunday evenings at BBB, it lasts all night.  delicious creme of asparagus soup, a large bone in pork chop with reduction, creamy mashed potatoes, a small mixed green salad, and the most delightful chocolate pot-au-creme for dessert.  for $16.50.  enough said.

also great for weekend brunch.  they do an excellent eggs benedict.   the hollandaise sauce is light and delicate, not heavy and oily.  homemade pate with petit cornichons  is always good. and where else can you regularly find rabbit on the menu? 

service can sometimes be spotty, but i chalk it up the the french atmosphere, and try to enjoy it.  it is a nice break from being rushed out the door, hat in hand.

j'aime baker street bistro.

excerpts: and I had the absolute best time.

it was juicy and very flavorfull.
It has a  really nice and romantic atmosphere and I love any place where the owner will come around to the tables to see how everyone is doing.

excerpts: There's something about waking up late on a sunny sunday morning with nothing to do and going to a little bistro to eat outside in the warmth and sip mimosas and chowing down on some delicoius breakfast foods AND lunch.
BRUNCH!
I adored this place and recommend it to everyone and anyone.
We hardly had to wait considering it was easter sunday and got a nice table outside in the sun.
I had the french toast and a glass of the mimosas and made my pal get the mussles with the pommes frites.
One of the most enjoyable moments in my San Francisco eating experiences.

I had the french toast and a glass of the mimosas and made my pal get the mussles with the pommes frites.  One of the most enjoyable moments in my San Francisco eating experiences.

excerpts: We had a great time.
Good service and good food.
Duck, salmon, and the steak and fries were good.
Desserts were good as well.
.author: Dan W.
.review: Really good. We had a great time.  Good service and good food.  Duck, salmon, and the steak and fries were good.  Desserts were good as well.

excerpts: The best eggs benny in town.
Served on a sunny sidewalk with rosemary potatoes and a mixed green salad.
Seriously, the best.
